result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristy L. Malnory was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week,

Absolute Sobriety,

No Contact with Victim unless approved by agent,

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, 

SAFE Program and Follow up, 

AODA and Follow up, 

Participate in the Marathon County Probation Review Hearings, 

DNA Sample.

(Defendant to complete the SAFE Program within the 9 Month period and if not, Probation to be extended until the Defendant completes the SAFE Program)

timeConds.notes: I&S jail to be used for rule violations
I&S to be used for rule violations

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristy L. Malnory

records.addlTxt:
Probation Review Hearing on 12/02/2022 @ 1:15 pm; Sent to Defendant. 
Return to Sender; Attempted- Not Known
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Probation review hearing on December 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Case Called: 2:02 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski in person. 
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Joseph Bauer in person. 
VRCW.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to:
Ct. 1 (Battery-Domestic Abuse)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.
 
PLEA: 
Ct. 2 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse)>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  
Defendant makes statements.

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 2 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse)>> Sentence W/H- 9 Months Probation. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, SAFE Program and Follow up, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, No Contact with Victim unless approved by agent, Participate in the Marathon County Probation Review Hearings, I/S 30 Hours of Community Service to be used for rule violations, I/S 30 Days Jail to be used for rule violations, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge, Domestic Abuse Surcharge. Court finds 0 Days Credit. 
(Defendant to complete the SAFE Program within the 9 Month period and if not, Probation to be extended until the Defendant completes the SAFE Program)

DATES:
Probation Review Hearing 12/02/2022 @ 1:15 pm

Adjourned: 2:15 pm

Minutes Amended 10/12/2022 @ 10:23 am- KW

Pre-trial conference on September 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Final pre-trial on October 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury status hearing on October 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury Trial on December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No contact with victim(s): N.G.C. or their residence. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence.

Case Called: 2:42 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski in person.  Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Heather Roehr in person.
VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

BOND: 
$500.00 Signature Bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): N.G.C. or their residence. 
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 

DATES:
PTC with JA 09/14 @ 9:45 am
FPT/TPD 10/07 @ 2:00 pm
JSH 10/25 @ 2:00 pm
JT  12/01 @ 8:30 am
